intro: Polycarena transvaalensis, commonly known as the Transvaal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Polycarena transvaalensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
